intro: Harpagophytum zeyheri f. sublobatum, commonly known as the wild quinine plant, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and have a rough texture. This species is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic compounds.
